channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Fed’s Independence Faces Critical Tests as Trump Seeks to Remake Institution
item.description: The central bank faces two major hurdles early on in 2026 that will determine the extent to which it operates free of political meddling.

item.title: Business leaders are growing more optimistic, JPMorgan survey finds
item.description: Almost two in five leaders at midsize businesses expressed optimism—especially about their own company’s future performance.

item.title: The Case for Real Regime Change in Venezuela
item.description: The former envoy Elliott Abrams says the administration should push harder.

item.title: China’s Threat to Block Rare Earths Has Put Japan on High Alert
item.description: Tokyo is concerned at signs that Beijing may be laying the groundwork to restrict access to the metals vital to manufacturing.

item.title: The most honest prediction for 2026: nobody knows what’s next
item.description: To my fellow CEOs: stop chasing certainty. Stop waiting for perfect information. Stop anchoring decisions to forecasts that will never be stable.

item.title: The curveball questions CEOs are asking job seekers amid Gen Z’s hiring nightmare: ‘Design a car for a deaf person’
item.description: Gen Z’s hiring nightmare is real. With fewer jobs and fiercer competition, employers are using curveball interview questions to separate candidates fr...

item.title: How JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon notched $770 million in gains for his work in 2025
item.description: Dimon has accumulated a lot of equity through his compensation plan, personal purchases, and via a 2021 special award.

item.title: Jollibee shares surge after the Filipino fried chicken chain says it’ll spin off its ‘higher-growth but more volatile’ global business
item.description: Jollibee is pursuing an aggressive global expansion, as it tries to grow beyond its profitable Filipino market.

item.title: Despite Little Research, Companies Race to Market Autism Tests
item.description: Backers claim the tests can predict a child’s risk of autism using a strand of hair or a mother’s blood, but critics say they are not ready for the ma...

item.title: Map: 6.4-Magnitude Earthquake Shakes the Philippine Sea
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: Trump Says Venezuela Will Start Handing Over Some Oil to U.S.
item.description: President Trump said Venezuelan officials had agreed to send millions of barrels. It would be their first major concession since the capture of Presid...

item.title: European Allies Agree to Key Security Provisions for Ukraine
item.description: Britain and France firmed up a postwar troop commitment in Ukraine, though Russia has said it will reject any deal that allows NATO-country forces in ...

item.title: The Cast and Creators of ‘KPop Demon Hunters’ on How the Movie Came to Be
item.description: As the filmmakers, songwriters and actors tell it, their “wackadoo” concept evolved over nine years and eight versions of “Golden” into a global pheno...

item.title: Swiss Bar Hit by Deadly Fire Was Not Inspected for 6 Years, Authorities Say
item.description: Officials in Crans-Montana, the Swiss alpine resort town where a bar fire killed 40 people last week, are facing growing accusations of lax oversight.
